1. XML Web Services Repository and Distributed Content Network
1. XML Web Services Repository and
Distributed Content Network

• NextPage NXT 3 P2P* Platform:
• NextPage NXT 3 P2P* Platform:

– Esther Dyson’s Release 1.0, 1/22/2002:
– Esther Dyson’s Release 1.0, 1/22/2002:

• “NextPage is unique in the content-management market
• “NextPage is unique in the content-management market

in its distributed approach”:
in its distributed approach”:

– “NextPage’s platform, NXT 3, virtually connects the distributed information sources and makes them appear integrated to the user. Unlike syndication, in which content is copied and integrated with other content locally, NextPage keeps objects where they are.”
– “NextPage’s platform, NXT 3, virtually connects the
distributed information sources and makes them
appear integrated to the user. Unlike syndication, in
which content is copied and integrated with other
content locally, NextPage keeps objects where they
are.”

– “NextPage uses the standard simple object access
– “NextPage uses the standard simple object access

protocol (SOAP) to exchange and normalize information between local content directories, assembling meta-indexes so that users can search or manipulate content transparently, regardless of physical location.”
protocol (SOAP) to exchange and normalize
information between local content directories,
assembling meta-indexes so that users can search
or manipulate content transparently, regardless of
physical location.”

*Peer-to-peer: Every device connected to the network is both a server and consumer of content.
*Peer-to-peer: Every device connected to the network is both a server and consumer of content.

2. EPA Emergency Response VoiceXML Application
2. EPA Emergency Response VoiceXML
Application

http://130.11.53.73/lepc/FMPro?-db=LEPC.FP5 &-format=-fmp_xml&zip_lepc::zip_code=22181&-find=
http://130.11.53.73/lepc/FMPro?-db=LEPC.FP5
&-format=-fmp_xml&zip_lepc::zip_code=22181&-find=

• FileMaker Pro 6 XML Query Syntax - Five Parts:
• FileMaker Pro 6 XML Query Syntax - Five Parts:

– The scheme: http – The host: IP address – The port: 591 (registered with IANA) – The file path: /FMPro – The query string: name=value pairs (4 in this case) separated by &
– The scheme: http
– The host: IP address
– The port: 591 (registered with IANA)
– The file path: /FMPro
– The query string: name=value pairs (4 in this case) separated by &

signs:
signs:

• The database (LEPC.FP5) • The format (FileMaker XML grammar - three choices: database dependent, database independent, and grammar) (fmp_xml)
• The database (LEPC.FP5)
• The format (FileMaker XML grammar - three choices: database
dependent, database independent, and grammar) (fmp_xml)

• The records to retrieve (zip_code=22181) • Request for data (yes)
• The records to retrieve (zip_code=22181)
• Request for data (yes)

2. EPA Emergency Response VoiceXML Application
2. EPA Emergency Response VoiceXML
Application

• Adam Hocek (Broadstokes, Inc.) created a script
• Adam Hocek (Broadstokes, Inc.) created a script

(http://www.broadstrokesinc.com/demo/cgi-bin/fmqry.pl) that returns the results from FileMaker as an ECMAScript. This makes it possible to use the same ECMAScript results within a VoiceXML or HTML document: – http://www.broadstrokesinc.com/demo/cgi-bin/jsvxml.pl – http://www.broadstrokesinc.com/demo/cgi-bin/jshtml.pl. • The file http://www.broadstrokesinc.com/demo/brand.vxml is used for collecting the callers zip code and then it does a <submit> to jsvxml.pl which will generate a VoiceXML document with the results.
(http://www.broadstrokesinc.com/demo/cgi-bin/fmqry.pl) that
returns the results from FileMaker as an ECMAScript. This
makes it possible to use the same ECMAScript results within a
VoiceXML or HTML document:
– http://www.broadstrokesinc.com/demo/cgi-bin/jsvxml.pl
– http://www.broadstrokesinc.com/demo/cgi-bin/jshtml.pl.
• The file http://www.broadstrokesinc.com/demo/brand.vxml is
used for collecting the callers zip code and then it does a
<submit> to jsvxml.pl which will generate a VoiceXML document
with the results.

• The VoiceXML application runs on Voxeo's server. Call 1-800-
• The VoiceXML application runs on Voxeo's server. Call 1-800-

303-9987 and give the application ID as 713589.
303-9987 and give the application ID as 713589.
